title.native: PERSONA3 THE MOVIE — #4 Winter of Rebirth —
title.romaji: PERSONA 3 THE MOVIE: #4 Winter of Rebirth
title.english: Persona 3 the Movie: #4 Winter of Rebirth

description: To know death, to gaze at death, to face death. Makoto and his allies have grown through the many meetings and partings they have experienced. Their fight might not be for the sake of the world, but for themselves. Even so, they have continued to fight, believing that there are peaceful days waiting at the end of the battle.

node.description:
Music composer of many Atlus videogame titles, he joined the company in 1995.

He left Atlus in September of 2021.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

ATLUS (株式会社アトラス Kabushiki-gaisha Atorasu) is a Japanese computer and video game developer, publisher, and distributor based in Tokyo, Japan, best known for developing the role-playing video game franchise Megami Tensei and the surgical simulation/visual novel franchise Trauma Center.  (Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakzo2010)

Takashi Sakurai is an animation producer and editor. Takashi Sakurai made his debut in the anime industry in 2003, at Tokyo Kids. He originally was one of the supporting editors at Tokyo Kids, and was later promoted as the general animation editor at the studio. Prior to working for the anime industry, he worked in the live-action industry, and did some CG work at production company Future Pirates. After working on Magikano, he left Tokyo Kids, and joined Anime International Company (AIC), as one of their in-house editors. Due to Sakurai joining the studio, AIC also began offering its editing services to other studios, such as TNK, for School Days. In 2010, he made his animation producer debut with Shukufuku no Campanella, due to it streamlining the production process at AIC. In 2014 he left AIC, and founded his own production company Typhoon Graphics Co., Ltd, otherwise known as Typhoon Graphics, in which its main services are: color design, color design inspection, finish animation, special effects, 2D design, photography, and editing work. 

He also has a good relationship with anime director Seiji Kishi, and after the success of 2006's co-production by GONZO and AIC's  "Seto no Hanayome", Kishi often started directing anime produced at AIC, such as: "Astro Fighter Sunred", "Persona 4: The Animation", and "Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita".

[Profile (Kick Factory)](https://www.kic-factory.co.jp/yumitama/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/YumiKawamura)

Yumi Kawamura is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger previously affiliated with the record labels Cutie Zaurus (2017), Kick Factory (2014), Istvan Media (1992–1993) and Toshima EMI (1996–1997). 

She is best known for singing the opening and ending theme songs, as well as some background music, in Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 and Shin Megami Tensei: Persona PSP.
Currently works at Atlus. Main character designer for Persona 3 onwards.

[Profile (Kick Factory)](https://www.kic-factory.co.jp/yumitama/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/YumiKawamura)

Yumi Kawamura is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger previously affiliated with the record labels Cutie Zaurus (2017), Kick Factory (2014), Istvan Media (1992–1993) and Toshima EMI (1996–1997). 

She is best known for singing the opening and ending theme songs, as well as some background music, in Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 and Shin Megami Tensei: Persona PSP.

node.description:
__[Website](https://www.lotusjuice.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lotusjuice)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/lotusjuicefanclub/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lotusjuice/)__

__Biography:__
 Lotus Juice, otherwise nicknamed アニキ (Aniki) is a Japanese rapper, known to be one of the pioneers in rap for official Japanese anime and game music. His rap music consists of 90's Hip Hop, J-Pop, Dub, Rock, Comedy, Love and many more. He is well known for his works with Shoji Meguro from ATLUS Japan, ripping the mic on the track "Mass Destruction" in the game Persona 3. 

He has been traveling around the world from Argentina, Mexico, to USA performing at anime and game conventions in front of his international fans. His unique flow has caught attention from [Taku Iwasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100172/Taku-Iwasaki), and their collaboration has gained substantial recognition.

(Source: [Lotus Juice's Official Website](https://www.lotusjuice.com/profile-english/))

[Profile (Kick Factory)](https://www.kic-factory.co.jp/yumitama/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/YumiKawamura)
